channel.title: All Bills
channel.description: A list of all bills published on Bills Online

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Access To Contraceptive Services
item.description: To make provision for access by the public for non-motorised boating purposes to the inland waterways of England and Wales; and for connected purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Access To Inland Waterways
item.description: To make provision for access by the public for non-motorised boating purposes to the inland waterways of England and Wales; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Age-Related Macular Degeneration
item.description: To make provision for the treatment of age-related macular degeneration; and for connected purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (Starting in the House of Lords)
item.title: Alcohol Labelling [HL]
item.description: To make provision for the labelling of alcoholic beverages; and for connected purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (Starting in the House of Lords)
item.title: Bailiffs (Licensing) [HL]
item.description: To make provision for the licensing of activities involving the judicial or quasijudicial seizure and sale of goods.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (Starting in the House of Lords)
item.title: Cluster Munitions (Prohibition) [HL]
item.description: To make provision for the control of cluster munitions; for the destruction of such munitions; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Concessionary Bus Travel [HL]
item.description: To make provision about travel concessions; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Consumers, Estate Agents and Redress [HL]
item.description: Make provision for the establishment of the National Consumer Council and its functions; to make provision for the abolition of other consumer bodies; to make provision about the handling of consumer complaints by certain suppliers and provision requiring certain suppliers to be members of redress schemes in respect of consumer complaints; to amend the Estate Agents Act 1979; to make provision about the cancellation of certain contracts concluded away from business premises; and for connected purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (Starting in the House of Lords)
item.title: Corruption [HL]
item.description: To make provision about corruption.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (Starting in the House of Lords)
item.title: Development Orders (Microgeneration) [HL] (formerly Energy Efficiency and Microgeneration [HL])
item.description: Make provision for a review of permitted development orders in relation to the installation, on agricultural land, of microgeneration equipment; and to make provision about the exercise of powers in consequence of the review.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (Starting in the House of Lords)
item.title: Disabled Persons (Independent Living) [HL]
item.description: Impose duties upon certain persons and bodies in respect of disabled persons; to confer certain rights upon disabled persons for independent living; to amend the Mental Health Act 1983; to amend the Care Standards Act 2000; and for connected purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (Starting in the House of Lords)
item.title: European Union (Implications of Withdrawal) [HL]
item.description: Establish a Committee of Inquiry into the implications of a withdrawal by the United Kingdom from the European Union.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (Starting in the House of Lords)
item.title: European Union (Information etc) [HL]
item.description: Make provision for information to be made available in various public places relating to the activities and organisation of the European Union; to make provision for the flying of the flag of the European Union on various public buildings; to provide information to further the establishment of twinning arrangements between towns in the United Kingdom and elsewhere in the European Union in accordance with the European Union's town twinning support scheme; and for connected purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (Starting in the House of Lords)
item.title: Forced Marriages (Civil Protection) [HL]
item.description: Make provision for protecting individuals against being forced to enter into marriage without their free and full consent; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Further Education and Training [HL]
item.description: Make provision about the Learning and Skills Council for England; to make provision about institutions within the further education sector; to make provision with respect to industrial training levies; to make provision about the formation of, and investment in, companies and charitable incorporated organisations by higher education corporations; to enable the making of Assembly Measures in relation to the field of education and training; and for connected purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (Starting in the House of Lords)
item.title: Government Spending (Website) [HL]
item.description: Make provision for a website in order to enable public access to information about government expenditure; and for connected purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (Starting in the House of Lords)
item.title: House of Lords [HL]
item.description: Make provision for the appointment of a Commission to make recommendations to the Crown for the creation of life peerages; to restrict membership of the House of Lords by virtue of hereditary peerage; to make provision for permanent leave of absence from the House of Lords; to provide for the expulsion of members of the House of Lords in specified circumstances; and for connected purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (Starting in the House of Lords)
item.title: House of Lords (Amendment) [HL]
item.description: Amend the House of Lords Act 1999.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (Starting in the House of Lords)
item.title: Interception of Communications (Admissability of Evidence) [HL]
item.description: Permit the introduction of intercept evidence and evidence of communications data in certain criminal proceedings; and for connected purposes.

item.title: International Tribunals (Sierra Leone) [HL]
item.description: Confer power to make provision in relation to the Special Court for Sierra Leone corresponding to that made in relation to the International Criminal Court by sections 42 to 48 of the International Criminal Court Act 2001.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (Starting in the House of Lords)
item.title: Leasehold Information [HL]
item.description: To amend the Land Registration Rules 2003 in relation to registered leasehold estates.

item.title: Legal Services [HL]
item.description: Make provision for the establishment of the Legal Services Board and in respect of its functions; to make provision for, and in connection with, the regulation of persons who carry on certain legal activities; to make provision for the establishment of the Office for Legal Complaints and for a scheme to consider and determine legal complaints; to make provision about claims management services and about immigration advice and immigration services; to make provision in respect of legal representation provided free of charge; to make provision about the application of the Legal Profession and Legal Aid (Scotland) Act 2006; to make provision about the Scottish legal services ombudsman; and for connected purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (Starting in the House of Lords)
item.title: Life Peerages (Residency for Taxation Purposes)
item.description: Amend the Life Peerages Act 1958 to provide a tax residency requirement for the conferral of life peerages under that Act.

item.title: Mental Health [HL]
item.description: Amend the Mental Health Act 1983 and the Mental Capacity Act 2005 in relation to mentally disordered persons; and for connected purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Climate Change (Effects)
item.description: To make requirements about the monitoring of measures to address the effects of climate change; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Land Use (Gardens Protection Etc)
item.description: Make provision for the protection of gardens and urban green space; to confer on local authorities powers to set housing density targets; to make provision about the transfer of land formerly used for economic purposes to residential use; to transfer to local authorities certain powers relating to housing and planning; and for connected purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Dance Teachers (Qualifications and Regulation)
Rating (Empty Properties)
item.description: Make provision for and in connection with the liability of owners of unoccupied hereditaments to a non-domestic rate.

item.title: Local Government and Public Involvement in Health
item.description: Make provision with respect to local government and the functions and procedures of local authorities and certain other authorities; to make provision with respect to persons with functions of inspection and audit in relation to local government; to establish the Valuation Tribunal for England; to make provision in connection with local involvement networks; to abolish Patients' Forums and the Commission for Patient and Public Involvement in Health; to make provision with respect to local consultation in connection with health services; and for connected purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Alcohol (Harm Reduction)
Digital Switchover (Disclosure of Information)
item.description: Make provision about the disclosure of certain information for purposes connected with digital switchover.

item.title: Local Planning Authorities (Energy and Energy Efficiency)
item.description: Enable local planning authorities to make certain requirements regarding the generation, conservation and use of energy; to require local planning authorities to consider specifying requirements for the generation of renewable and low carbon energy and the imposition of energy efficiency standards when determining planning applications; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Retail Packaging (Recycling)
item.description: Require that certain retailers shall provide free of charge a collection point for any packaging materials sold or supplied by them; and to require them to recycle or safely dispose of such materials.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Media (Transparency and Disclosure)

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Members of Parliament (Employment Disqualification)
item.description: Make provision for the regulation of remunerated employment of Members of Parliament; and for connected purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Animals Act (Amendment)
item.description: Amend the Animals Act 1971 to limit strict liability for damage done by animals.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (Starting in the House of Lords)
item.title: Royal Commission (Slavery) [HL]
item.description: Make provision for the establishment of a Royal Commission on slavery.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Milk (Pricing)

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Armed Forces (Federation)

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: National Institute for Health and Clinical Excellence (Impact on Carers)
Northern Ireland (St Andrews Agreement)
item.description: Make provision for preparations for the restoration of devolved government in Northern Ireland in accordance with the St Andrews Agreement; to make provision as to the consequences of compliance, or non-compliance, with the St Andrews Agreement timetable; to amend the Northern Ireland Act 1998; to make provision about district policing partnerships; to amend the Education (Northern Ireland) Orders 1997 and 2006; and for connected purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Bilingual Juries (Wales)
item.description: To amend section 10 of the Juries Act 1974 to provide that in certain cases all members of a jury be bilingual in Welsh and English; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Building Societies (Funding) and Mutual Societies (Transfers) (Formerly known as Financial Arrangements)
item.description: To remove existing funding limits in respect of building societies, subject to regulation by the Financial Services Authority; to provide consequential rights to building society members; and to enable specified categories of mutual organisations to transfer engagements to one another or to a company.

item.title: Northern Ireland (St Andrews Agreement) (No.2)
item.description: Modify the effect of the Northern Ireland (St Andrews Agreement) Act 2006.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Disability Benefits (Single Assessment)

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Rural Tranquility
item.description: Provide for the establishment of an indicator for rural tranquillity; to provide for the protection of rural tranquillity in the planning process; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Offender Management
item.description: Make provision about the provision of probation services, prisons and other matters relating to the management of offenders; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Disabled Children (Family Support)
item.description: Make provision about the assessment and delivery of short breaks and respite care for carers of disabled children; to amend the law relating to disabled children and their carers; to place duties on local authorities and the National Health Service in respect of disabled children and their carers; and for connected purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Safeguarding Runaway and Missing Children
item.description: To require the Secretary of State to establish a national strategy to safeguard runaway and missing children; to make provision for the collection and reporting of information about runaway and missing children and for related co-ordination between local authorities and other bodies; and for connected purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Carers (Identification Support)
item.description: To require health bodies to identify patients who are carers or who have a carer; to require identified carers to be referred to sources of help and support and to make further provision in relation to such arrangements; to make provision in relation to the responsibilities of local authorities and schools for the needs of young carers and their families; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Off-Road Vehicles (Registration)
item.description: To make provision for the establishment of a compulsory registration scheme for off-road vehicles; and forconnected purposes.

item.title: Serious Crime [HL]
item.description: Make provision about serious crime prevention orders; to create offences inrespect of the encouragement or assistance of crime; to enable information tobe shared or processed to prevent fraud; to enable data matching to beconducted both in relation to fraud and for other purposes; to transferfunctions of the Director of the Assets Recovery Agency to the SeriousOrganised Crime Agency and other persons and to make further provision inconnection with the abolition of the Agency and the office of Director; toamend the Proceeds of Crime Act 2002 in relation to certain investigations andin relation to accredited financial investigators and search warrants; to makeamendments relating to Her Majesty's Revenue and Customs in connectionwith the regulation of investigatory powers; and for connected purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Drugs (Reclassification and Roadside Testing)
item.description: Provide for the reclassification of cannabis; to make provision for the roadside testing of illegal drugs; and for connected purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (Starting in the House of Lords)
item.title: Palliative Care [HL]
Electric Shock Training Devices
item.description: Prohibit the sale, manufacture, hire, loan, importation or use of electric shock training devices; and for connected purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Palliative Care (No.2)
Parliament (Joint Departments) [HL]
item.description: To provide for joint departments of the Houses of Parliament; and for connected purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Employment Assistance (Wales)

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Employment Retention
item.description: Make provision for a statutory right to rehabilitation leave for newly disabled people and people whose existing impairments change; and for connected purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Energy Markets (Carbon Reduction and Warm Homes)
item.description: Promote sustainable energy and energy efficiency; to make further provision in respect of the regulation of the gas and electricity industries; to provide OFGEM with new environmental and social duties; to make further provision about the role of local authorities in meeting the United Kingdomâ€™s carbon reduction and fuel poverty targets; and for connected purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (Starting in the House of Lords)
item.title: Parliamentary Constituencies (Amendment) [HL]
item.description: To reduce the number of parliamentary constituencies; amend the rules governing the number of electors in each constituency; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Energy Saving (Daylight)
item.description: Advance time by one hour throughout the year to create lighter evenings, for an experimental period; and for connected purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Pedlars (Street Trading Regulation)
item.description: Confer further powers on local authorities for the regulation of street trading by pedlars; and for connected purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Speed Limits (Amendment)

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Flexible Working
Statistics and Registration Service
item.description: Establish and make provision about the Statistics Board; to make provision about offices and office-holders under the Registration Service Act 1953; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Fraud (Trials Without a Jury)
item.description: Make amendments of and in relation to section 43 of the Criminal Justice Act 2003.

item.title: Streetscape and Highways Design
item.description: Make provision about standards of streetscape and highways design; to require the Secretary of State to provide guidance and advice to local authorities and the Highways Agency on streetscape and highways design; to require local authorities to publish policies on the quality of design of traffic signs and highway developments; to require local authorities to have regard to such policies when causing or permitting traffic signs to be placed on or near a road or when carrying out highways work; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Freedom of Information (Amendment)
item.description: Amend the Freedom of Information Act 2000 to exempt from its provisions the House of Commons and House of Lords and correspondence between Members of Parliament and public authorities.

item.title: Sustainable Communities
item.description: Make provision for the Secretary of State to publish action plans in connection with promoting the sustainability of local communities and to enable local authorities and local communities to participate in the formulation and implementation of those plans; to require the Secretary of State to provide information on government spending in local authority areas to local authorities upon request; to make provision for local authorities to produce local spending plans; to require the Secretary of State to approve and implement those plans; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Freedom of Information (Amendment) (No.2)
item.description: Amend the Freedom of Information Act 2000 to remove the provisions permitting Ministers to overrule decisions of the Information Commissioner and Information Tribunal; to limit the time allowed for public authorities to respond to requests involving consideration of the public interest; to amend the definition of public authorities; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Telecommunications Masts (Planning Control)
item.description: Amend the law relating to planning in connection with telecommuniciations masts and associated apparatus; to amend the electronic communications code in connection with telecommunications masts and associated apparatus and make further provision about that code; and for connected purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (Starting in the House of Lords)
item.title: Television Advertising (Food) [HL]
item.description: Make provision about the advertising of food products on television programme services; and for connected purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Gangmasters (Licensing) Act 2004
Temporary and Agency Workers (Prevention of Less Favourable Treatment)
item.description: Prohibit discrimination against temporary and agency workers; to make provision about the enforcement of rights of such workers; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Termination of Pregnancy
item.description: Reduce the time limit for legal terminations of pregnancy from 24 to 20 weeks; to introduce a cooling-off period after the first point of contact with a medical practitioner about a termination; to require the provision of counselling about the medical risk of, and about matters relating to, termination and bringing the pregnancy to term as a condition of informed consent to termination; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Greater London Authority
item.description: Make further provision with respect to the Greater London Authority; to amend the Greater London Authority Act 1999; to make further provision with respect to the functional bodies, within the meaning of that Act, and the Museum of London; and for connected purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (Starting in the House of Lords)
item.title: Torture (Damages) [HL]
item.description: Make provision for actions for damages for torture; and for connected purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Town and Country Planning (Amendment)
Trade Union Rights and Freedoms
item.description: Make provision for the law relating to the rights and freedoms of workers and of trade unions, the regulation of relations between employers and workers, protection of employment in lawful industrial action, and remedies in trade disputes; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Health and Safety (Offences)
item.description: Amend section 33 of the Health and Safety at Work etc. Act 1974.

item.title: Tribunals, Courts and Enforcement [HL]
item.description: Make provision about tribunals and inquiries; to establish an Administrative Justice and Tribunals Council; to amend the law relating to judicial appointments; to amend the law relating to the enforcement of judgments and debts; to make further provision about the management and relief of debt; to make provision protecting cultural objects from seizure or forfeiture in certain circumstances; to amend the law relating to the taking of possession of land affected by compulsory purchase; to alter the powers of the High Court in judicial review applications; and for connected purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Historic Counties, Towns and Villages (Traffic Signs and Mapping)
item.description: Amend the law so as to require traffic authorities to cause traffic signs to be placed on or near roads for the purpose of indicating the location of historic county, town and village boundaries; to require the Ordnance Survey of Great Britain and Northern Ireland to mark the boundaries of the historic counties, towns and villages on its maps; and for connected purposes.

item.title: House of Commons (Participation)
item.description: Provide for the Speaker of the House of Commons to have power to determine the eligibility of members of the House of Commons to participate in certain legislative and other proceedings of that House.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Houses in Multiple Occupation
Housing Association (Rights and Representation of Residents)
item.description: Make provision about the rights and representation of housing association residents; to make requirements of housing associations in relation to service delivery; to make further provision for the regulation of housing associations; and for connected purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Human Rights Act 1998 (Meaning of Public Authority)
item.description: Clarify the meaning of â€œpublic authorityâ€ in section 6 of the Human Rights Act 1998.

item.title: UK Borders
item.description: Make provision about immigration and asylum; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Infrastructure Audit (Housing Development)
item.description: Require an audit of existing or planned infrastructure in areas of significant housing development.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Intergovernmental Contracts (Provision of Information)
Vehicle Registration Marks
item.description: To make further provision about the retention of vehicle registration marks pending transfer.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Catholics (Prevention of Discrimination)
Child Maintenance and Other Payments
item.description: A Bill to establish the Child Maintenance and Enforcement Commission; to amend the law relating to child support; to make provision about lump sum payments to or in respect of persons with diffuse mesothelioma; and for connected purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Childcare Provision (Wales)
Citizens' Convention
item.description: To establish a Citizensâ€™ Convention to facilitate the involvement of people from all sections of society in considering the way in which the United Kingdom is governed; to make provision relating to the implementation of recommendations made by the Convention; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Cluster Munitions (Prohibition of Development and Aquisition)
item.description: To prohibit the development, acquisition, possession, transfer and use of cluster munitions and their components; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Consolidated Fund
item.description: To authorise the use of resources for the service of the years ending with 31st March 2007 and 31st March 2008 and to apply certain sums out of the Consolidated Fund to the service of the years ending with 31st March 2007 and 31st March 2008.

item.title: Consolidated Fund (Appropriation)
item.description: To authorise the use of resources for the service of the years ending with 31st March 2006 and 31st March 2007 and to apply certain sums out of the Consolidated Fund to the service of the years ending with 31st March 2006 and 31st March 2007; and to appropriate the supply authorised in this Session of Parliament for the service of the years ending with 31st March 2006 and 31st March 2007.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (Starting in the House of Lords)
item.title: Victims of Overseas Terrorism [HL]
item.description: Make provision for advice and assistance to victims of acts of terrorism taking place outside the United Kingdom; for arrangements under which insurance is made available to individuals in respect of risks against injury resulting from acts of terrorism taking place outside the United Kingdom; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Consolidated Fund (Appropriation) (No.2)
item.description: To authorise the use of resources for the service of the year ending with 31st March 2008 and to apply certain sums out of the Consolidated Fund to the service of the year ending with 31st March 2008; to appropriate the supply authorised in this Session of Parliament for the service of the year ending with 31st March 2008; and to repeal certain Consolidated Fund and Appropriation Acts.

item.title: Waging War (Parliament's Role and Responsibilty)
item.description: Require the Secretary of State to lay before the House of Commons a mechanism for obtaining the approval of that House for the deployment of British forces for armed conflict.

item.title: Constitutional Reform
item.description: To provide for the drawing up of a written constitution for the United Kingdom; for its consideration by the people and Parliament of the United Kingdom; and for connected purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Copyright (Miscellaneous Provisions)

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Copyright Term for Performers and Producers

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Council Housing (Direct Investment)

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Criminal Damage Graffiti
Criminal Justice and Immigration
item.description: A Bill to make further provision about criminal justice (including provision about the police) and dealing with offenders and defaulters; to provide for the establishment and functions of Her Majestyâ€™s Commissioner for Offender Management and Prisons and to make further provision about the management of offenders; to amend the criminal law; to make further provision for combatting crime and disorder; to make provision about the mutual recognition of financial penalties; to make provision for a new immigration status in certain cases involving criminality; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Criminal Law (Amendment) (Protection of Property)
item.description: Amend section 3 of the Criminal Law Act 1967 and section 3 of the Criminal Law Act (Northern Ireland) 1967 in relation to the use of force in the prevention of crime or in the defence of persons or property.

item.title: Crossrail
item.description: Make provision for a railway transport system running from Maidenhead, in the County of Berkshire, and Heathrow Airport, in the London Borough of Hillingdon, through central London to Shenfield, in the County of Essex, and Abbey Wood, in the London Borough of Greenwich; and for connected purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Wild Birds (Protection)

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Young Offenders (Provision of Speech Therapy)
Crown Employment (Nationality)
item.description: Make provision for and in connection with the removal of general restrictions as to nationality which apply to persons employed or holding office in any civil capacity under the Crown; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Welfare Reform
item.description: Make provision about social security; to amend the Vaccine Damage Payments Act 1979; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Cystic Fibrosis (Exemption from Prescription Charges)
item.description: Exempt persons with cystic fibrosis from charges for drugs, medicines, appliances and pharmaceutical services; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Pensions
item.description: Make provision about pensions and other benefits payable to persons in connection with bereavement or by reference to pensionable age; to make provision about the establishment and functions of the Personal Accounts Delivery Authority; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Pensions (Unclaimed Assets)
item.description: Establish an Unclaimed Assets Agency; to confer powers on the Agency to obtain information from banks and building societies relating to unclaimed assets; to make provision for the transfer of a proportion of unclaimed assets to the Agency for distribution among certain members of occupational pension schemes; and for connected purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (Starting in the House of Lords)
item.title: Piped Music etc (Hospitals) [HL]
item.description: Provide for the Secretary of State to draw up a plan to prohibit piped music and the showing of television programmes in the public areas of hospitals; and to require the wearing of headphones by persons listening to music in the public areas of hospitals.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Planning (Consultation)
Planning-Gain Supplement (Preparations)
item.description: Permit expenditure in preparation for the imposition of a tax on the increase inthe value of land resulting from the grant of permission for development.

item.title: Polling Stations (Regulation)
item.description: Make it an offence to campaign in prescribed areas around polling stations on the day of certain elections; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Post-16 Education and Training
item.description: Make provision about post-16 education and training; to amend the law relating to the definition of compulsory school age; and for connected purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Prenuptial Agreements Title

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Private Parking (Regulations)

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Proof of Age Scheme (Purchase of Restricted Goods)
Protection of Adults in Care (Prevention of Harm and Exploitation)
item.description: Amend the Human Rights Act 1998 to extend the definition of public authority to include any body acting pursuant to a contract with a public body to perform a function of a public nature; to confer new functions on local authorities in relation to persons in need of care or protection provided by such authorities; and for connected purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Protection of Listed Vehicles
Provision of Palliative Care
item.description: Require the provision of palliative care for persons suffering from a terminal illness; and for connected purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (Starting in the House of Lords)
item.title: Public Demonstrations (Repeals) [HL]
item.description: Amend certain provisions of the Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 and other legislative restraints on public demonstrations; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Investment Exchanges and Clearing Houses
item.description: Confer power on the Financial Services Authority to disallow excessive regulatory provision by recognised investment exchanges and clearing houses; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Justice and Security (Northern Ireland)
item.description: Make provision about justice and security in Northern Ireland.

item.title: Income Tax
item.description: Restate, with minor changes, certain enactments relating to income tax; andfor connected purposes.

item.title: Finance
item.description: To grant certain duties, to alter other duties, and to amend the law relating to the National Debt and the Public Revenue, and to make further provision in connection with finance.

item.title: Corporate Manslaughter and Corporate Homicide
item.description: To create a new offence that, in England and Wales or Northern Ireland, is to be called corporate manslaughter and, in Scotland, is to be called corporate homicide; and to make provision in connection with that offence.

item.title: Fixed Term Parliaments
item.description: Fix the date of the next general election and all subsequent general elections; to forbid the dissolution of Parliament otherwise than in accordance with this Act; to allow the House of Commons to change the day of the week on which a general election is held; and for connected purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Ports (Regulation)

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Bicycles (Children's Safety Helmets)

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Access to Pension Protection Fund Benefits

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Packaging (Reduction)

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Grandparents (Rights of Access)
Local Transport [HL]
item.description: A Bill to make further provision in relation to local transport authorities, the provision and regulation of road transport services and the subsidising of passenger transport services; to amend sections 74, 75 and 79 of the Transport Act 1985; to make provision for or in relation to committees which represent the interests of users of public transport; to rename the Passenger Transport Authorities as Integrated Transport Authorities and to make further provision in relation to them; to make further provision in relation to charging for the use of roads; to make provision in relation to the acquisition, disclosure and use of information relating to vehicles registered outside the United Kingdom; and for connected purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (Starting in the House of Lords)
item.title: Powers of Entry etc. [HL]
item.description: A Bill to regulate powers of entry and powers in relation to documents; and for connected purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (Starting in the House of Lords)
item.title: Disabled Persons (Independent Living) [HL]
item.description: A Bill to impose duties upon certain persons and bodies in respect of disabled persons; to confer certain right upon disabled persons for independent living; to amend the Mental Health Act 1983; to amend the Care Standards Act 2000; and for connected purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (Starting in the House of Lords)
item.title: House of Lords [HL]
item.description: A Bill to make provision for the appointment of a Commission to make recommendations to the Crown for the creation of life peerages; to restrict membership of the House of Lords by virtue of hereditary peerage; to make provision for permanent leave of absence from the House of Lords; to provide for the expulsion of members of the House of Lords in specified circumstances; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Dormant Bank and Building Society Accounts [HL]
item.description: A Bill to make provision for, and in connection with, using money from dormant bank and building society accounts for social or environmental purposes.

item.title: European Communities (Finance)
item.description: A Bill to amend the definition of 'the Treaties' and 'the Community Treaties' in section 1(2) of the European Communities Act 1972 so as to include the decision of 7th June 2007 of the Council on the Communities' system of own resources

item.title: Channel Tunnel Rail Link (Supplementary Provisions)
item.description: A Bill to make provision amending, and supplementary to, the Channel Tunnel Rail Link Act 1996

item.title: Sale of Student Loans
item.description: A bill to enable the sale of rights to repayments of student loans; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Human Fertilisation and Embryology [HL]
item.description: A Bill to amend the Human Fertilisation and Embryology Act 1990 and the Surrogacy Arrangements Act 1985; to make provision about the persons who in certain circumstances are to be treated in law as the parents of a child; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Regulatory Enforcement and Sanctions [HL]
item.description: A Bill to make provision for the establishment of the Local Better Regulation Office; for the co-ordination of regulatory enforcement by local authorities; for the creation of civil sanctions in relation to regulatory offences; for the reduction and removal of regulatory burdens; and for connected purposes.

item.title: National Insurance Contributions
item.description: A Bill to make provision in connection with the upper earnings limit for national insurance contributions (including in particular provision about the upper accrual point)

item.title: Children and Young Persons [HL]
item.description: A Bill to make provision about the delivery of local authority social work services for children and young persons; to amend Parts 2 and 3 of the Children Act 1989; to make further provision about the functions of local authorities and others in relation to children and young persons; to make provision about the enforcement of care standards in relation to certain establishments or agencies connected with children; to make provision about the independent review of determinations relating to adoption; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Climate Change [HL]
item.description: A Bill to set a target for the year 2050 for the reduction of targeted greenhouse gas emissions; to provide for a system of carbon budgeting; to establish a Committee on Climate Change; to confer powers to establish trading schemes for the purpose of limiting greenhouse gas emissions or encouraging activities that reduce such emissions or remove greenhouse gas from the atmosphere; to make provision about adaptation to climate change; to confer powers to make schemes for providing financial incentives to produce less domestic waste and to recycle more of what is produced; to amend the provisions of the Energy Act 2004 about renewable transport fuel obligations; to make other provisions about climate change; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Housing and Regeneration
item.description: Housing and Regeneration Bill to establish the Homes and Communities Agency and make provision about it; to abolish the Urban Regeneration Agency and Commission for the New Towns and make provision in connection with their abolition; to regulate social housing; to enable the abolition of the Housing Corporation; to make provision about sustainability certificates, landlord and tenant matters, building regulations and mobile homes; to make further provision about housing; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Health and Social Care
item.description: A Bill to establish and make provision in connection with a Care Quality Commission; to make provision about health care (including provision about the National Health Service) and about social care; to make provision about reviews and investigations under the Mental Health Act 1983; to establish and make provision in connection with an Office of the Health Professions Adjudicator and make other provision about the regulation of the health care professions; to confer power to modify the regulation of social care workers; to amend the Public Health (Control of Disease) Act 1984; to provide for the payment of a grant to women in connection with pregnancy; to amend the functions of the Health Protection Agency; and for connected purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (Starting in the House of Lords)
item.title: Alcohol Labelling [HL]
item.description: A Bill to make provision for the labelling of alcoholic beverages; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Planning
item.description: A Bill to establish the Infrastructure Planning Commission and make provision about its functions; to make provision about, and about matters ancillary to, the authorisation of projects for the development of nationally significant infrastructure; to make provision about town and country planning; to make provision about the imposition of a Community Infrastructure Levy; and for connected purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (Starting in the House of Lords)
item.title: Kidney Transplant [HL]
item.description: A Bill to make provision about kidney donation.

item.title: Education and Skills
item.description: A Bill to make provision about education and training; and for connected purposes.

item.title: London Local Authorities
item.description: To confer further powers upon local authorities in London; and for related purposes.

item.title: Bournemouth Borough Council
item.description: To confer powers on Bournemouth Borough Council for the better control of street trading in the borough of Bournemouth.

item.title: Broads Authority
item.description: To confer further powers on the Broads Authority; to make other provisions as to that Authority; and for related purposes.

item.title: London Local Authorities and Transport for London
item.description: To confer further powers upon local authorities in London and upon Transport for London; and for related purposes.

item.title: Manchester City Council
item.description: To confer powers on Manchester City Council for the better control of street trading in the city of Manchester.

item.title: Transport for London
item.description: To confer further powers upon Transport for London; and for related purposes.

item.title: Transport for London (Supplemental Toll Provisions)
item.description: To confer further powers upon Transport for London; and for related purposes.

item.title: Leeds City Council
item.description: To confer powers on Leeds City Council for the better control of street trading in the city of Leeds.

item.title: Northern Bank
item.description: To provide that the statutory right of Northern Bank Limited to issue bank notes shall transfer and apply to Danske Bank A/S; and for connected purposes.

item.title: St. Austell Market
item.description: To provide for the vesting of the undertaking of The Commissioners of St. Austell Markets and Fairs in St. Austell Market House CIC and for the continuance of that undertaking; to repeal the St. Austell Market Act 1842; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Canterbury City Council
item.description: To confer powers on Canterbury City Council for the better control of street trading and touting in the city of Canterbury.

item.title: London Local Authorities and Transport for London (No. 2)
item.description: To confer further powers upon local authorities in London and upon Transport for London; and for related purposes.

item.title: London Local Authorities (Shopping Bags)
item.description: To introduce in London a prohibition on the supply of certain bags by retailers, to confer powers upon local authorities in London to enforce the prohibition; and for related purposes.

item.title: Nottingham City Council
item.description: To confer powers on Nottingham City Council for the better control of street trading in the city of Nottingham.

item.title: Reading Borough Council
item.description: To confer powers on Reading Borough Council for the better control of street trading and touting in the borough of Reading.

item.title: Pensions
item.description: A Bill to make provision relating to pensions; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Consolidated Fund
item.description: Authorise the use of resources for the service of the years ending with 31st March 2008 and 31st March 2009 and to apply certain sums out of the Consolidated Fund to the service of the years ending with 31st March 2008 and 31st March 2009.

item.title: Planning and Energy
item.description: A Bill to enable local planning authorities to set requirements for energy generation and energy efficiency in local plans

item.title: Special Educational Needs (Information)
item.description: A Bill to amend the Education Act 1996 in relation to the provision and publication of information about children who have special educational needs; and for connected purposes

item.title: Temporary and Agency Workers (Equal Treatment)
item.description: A Bill to provide for the protection of temporary and agency workers; to require the principle of equal treatment to be applied to temporary and agency workers; to make provision about the enforcement of rights of temporary and agency workers; and for connected purposes

item.title: British Board of Film Classification (Accountability to Parliament and Appeals)
item.description: A Bill to make provision for parliamentary scrutiny of senior appointments to the British Board of Film Classification and of guildlines produced by it; to establish a body with powers to hear appeals against the release of videos and DVDs and the classification of works in prescribed circumstances; to make provision about penalties for the distribution of illegal works; and for connect purposes

item.title: Private Equity (Transfer of Undertakings and Protection of Employment)
Animals Act 1971 (Amendment)
item.description: A Bill to amend the Animals Act 1971 to limit strict liability for damage done by animals

item.title: Food Products (Marketing to Children)
item.description: A Bill to make provision about the advertising, marketing and promotion of food and drink products to children; and for connected purposes

item.title: Environmental Protection (Transfers at Sea)
item.description: A Bill to make provision about provision about transfers of cargo at sea; to provide for environmental safeguards in relation to such transfers; and for connected purposes

item.title: Health and Safety (Offences)
item.description: A Bill to revise the mode of trial and maximum penalties applicable to certain offences relating to health and safety

item.title: Energy Saving (Daylight)
item.description: A Bill to advance time by one hour throughtout the year to create lighter evenings, for an experimental period; and for connected purposes

item.title: Voting Age (Reduction)
item.description: A Bill to reduce the voting age for parliamentary and other elections to 16 years

item.title: Fixed Term Parliaments
item.description: A Bill to fix the date of the next general election and all subsequent elections; to allow the House of Commons to change the day of the week on which a general election is held; and for connected purposes

item.title: Forces Widows' Pensions (Equality of Treatment)
item.description: A Bill to provide for the equal treatment of Forces widows' pensions in respect of retirement from military service for the periods before 1973 and between 1973 and 2005; and for connected purposes

item.title: Leasehold Reform
item.description: A Bill to amend the law relating to long leaseholders; to confer further powers on leaseholders; to make provision in relation to leaseholders in local council owned property and property owned by other social landlords; to confer powers on landlords to create sinking funds; to make requirements of landlords relating to the management of property; for conencted purposes

item.title: Borough Freedom
item.description: A Bill to enable rights of admission to the freedom of cities or towns to be extended to women; to enable other amendments relating to admission to be made; to confer powers to admit persons as honorary freemen of certain places in the Confederation of the Clinque Ports; and for connected purposes

item.title: Sound Recordings (Copyright Term Extension)
item.description: A Bill to extend beyond 50 years the copyright term of sound recordings; and for connected purposes

item.title: Environmental Protection (Airports)
item.description: A Bill to promote the protection of the environment near airports; to establish a body to monitor the enviromental impact of airports and to report levels of pollution; to confer certain powers on that body; and for connected purposes

item.title: Public Sector Buildings (Energy Performance)
item.description: A BIll to make further provision about energy efficiency and microgeneration in public sector buildings; and for conencted purposes

item.title: Foreign Nationals (Statistics)
item.description: A Bill to establish a requirement on local authorities to transfer certain statistics relating to nationality to the Office of National Statistics; and for connected purposes

item.title: Disqualification from Parliament (Taxation Status)
item.description: A Bill to make provision for disqualification from membership of the House of Commons and the House of Lords on grounds relating to residence and domicile for taxation purposes; and for connected purposes

item.title: Employment
item.description: A Bill to make provision about the procedure for the resolution of employment disputes; to provide for compensation for financial loss in cases of unlawful underpayment or non-payment; to make provision about the enforcement of minimum wages legislation and the application of the national minimum wage to Cadet Force Adult Volunteers; to make provision about the enforcement of offences under the Employment Agencies Act 1973; to make provision about the right of trade unions to expel or exclude members on the grounds of membership of a political party; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Drugs (Reclassification)
item.description: A Bill to provide for the reclassification of cannabis

item.title: Drugs (Roadside Testing)
item.description: The Bill would make provision for roadside testing for illegal drugs.

item.title: Broadcasting (Television Licence Fee Abolition)
item.description: A Bill to make provision for the abolition of the television licence fee; and for connected purposes

item.title: Sovereignty of Parliament (European Communities)
item.description: A Bill to provide that Community treaties, Community instruments and Community obligations shall only be binding in legal proceedings in the United Kingdom insofar as they do not conflict with a subsequent, expressly inconsitent enactment of the Parliament of the United Kingdom

item.title: European Union (Audit of Benefits and Costs of UK Membership)
item.description: A Bill to establish a Commission to carry out regular audits of the economic costs and benfits of the UK's membership of the European Union; and for connected purposes

item.title: Road Traffic (Congestion Reduction)
item.description: A Bill to place a duty on highway authorities and police forces to minimise congestion and delays caused by collisions and other incidents on the highway; and for connected purposes

item.title: Pedlars (Street Trading Regulations)
item.description: A Bill to confer further powers on local authorities for the regulation of street trading by pedlars; and for connected purposes

item.title: European Union (Amendment)
item.description: A Bill to make provision in connection with the Treaty of Lisbon Amending the Treaty on European Union and the Treaty Establishing the European Community, signed at Lisbon on 13th December 2007.

item.title: Citizens' Convention
item.description: A Bill to establish a Citizens' Convention to facilitate the involvement of people from all sections of society in considering the way in which the United Kingdom is governed; and for connected purposes

item.title: Expenses of Public Servants (Publication)
item.description: A Bill to make provision for the recording and publication of specific expenses incurred by certain public servants; to promote transparency in the use if public funds; and for connected purposes

item.title: Road Traffic (Prohibition of Anti-Detection Devices)
item.description: A Bill to prohibit the supply of devices and substances designed to impair the recognition of vehicle registration marks by speed cameras and other authorised traffic control devices; and for connected purposes

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Human Rights Act 1998 (Meaning of Public Function)
item.description: A Bill to clarify the meaning of 'public function' in section 6 of the Human Rights Act 1998

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Umbilical Cord Blood (Donation)
item.description: A Bill to Promote the donation of cord blood from women after giving birth; and for connected purposes

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Runaway and Missing Children
item.description: A Bill to make requirements regarding the safeguarding of runaway and missing children; and for connected purposes

item.title: Energy
item.description: A Bill to make provision relating to gas importation and storage; to make provision in relation to electricity generated from renewable sources; to make provision about the decommissioning of energy installations and wells; to make provision about the management and disposal of waste produced during the operation of nuclear installations; to make provision relating to petroleum licences; to make provision about third party access to oil and gas infrastructure and modifications of pipelines; to make provision about reports relating to energy matters; to make provision relating to gas meters and electricity meters and provision relating to electricity safety; to make provision about the security of equipment, software and information relating to nuclear matters; and for connected purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Planning (Location of Hazardous Sites)
item.description: A Bill to require the introduction of binding guidance regarding minimum distances between developments classified as Control of Major Accident Hazard sities and other specified types of building; and for connected purposes

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Education (Children with Autism)
item.description: A Bill to make provision about education and training of children with autism and Asperger's syndrome; and for connected purposes

item.category: Private Members' Bill (Starting in the House of Lords)
item.title: House of Lords (Amendment)
item.description: A Bill to amend the House of Lords Act 1999.

item.title: Football Spectators and Sports Grounds
item.description: A Bill to amend the law relating to football banning orders and their enforcement; to confer further powers on the Football Licensing Authority and to amend its name; and for connected purposes

item.category: Private Members' Bill (Starting in the House of Lords)
item.title: Retail Development
item.description: A Bill to provide support for small retail premises; to establish the Office for Retail Planning; to make provision about retail planning and development; and for connected purposes

item.title: Climate Change (Sectoral Targets)
item.description: A Bill to set sectoral targets relating to energy generation and consumption; to make provision for the sectoral targets to be met; and for connected purposes

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Online Purchasing of Goods and Services (Age Verification)
item.description: A Bill to make it a requirement for the providers of goods and services and the providers of specific facilities enabling the purchase of such goods and services to make reasonable steps, in certain circumstances, to establish the age of customers making such purchases remotely; and for connected purposes

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Christmas Savings Schemes (Regulation)
item.description: A Bill to make provision for the regulation of Christmas savings schemes; and for connected purposes

item.title: Counter-Terrorism
item.description: A Bill to Confer further powers to gather and share information for counter-terrorism and other purposes; to make further provision about the detention and questioning of terrorist suspects and the prosecution and punishment of terrorist offences; to impose notification requirements on persons convicted of such offences; to amend the law relating to asset freezing proceedings under United Nations terrorism orders; to amend the law relating to inquests and inquiries; to amend the definition of â€œterrorismâ€; to amend the enactments relating to terrorist offences, control orders and the forfeiture of terrorist cash; to provide for recovering the costs of policing at certain gas facilities; to amend provisions about the appointment of special advocates in Northern Ireland; and for connected purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Employment Retention

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Sale of Wine (Measures)
item.description: A Bill to require licensed premises which sell wine by the glass to offer measures of 125ml

item.category: Private Members' Bill (Starting in the House of Lords)
item.title: Safety Deposit Current Accounts
item.description: A Bill to make provision for the introduction of a mandatory requirement for banks and building societies to offer safety deposit current accounts to allow money to be stored for safe-keeping; and for connected purposes.

item.title: National Trust (Northern Ireland)
item.description: An Act to make provisions as to the National Trust for Places of Historic Interest or Natural Beauty in relation to Northern Ireland.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (Starting in the House of Lords)
item.title: Torture (Damages)
item.description: A Bill to make provision for actions for damages for torture; and for connected purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Union Flag
item.description: A Bill to define the Union Flag of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland; to make provision about the display and flying of the Union Flag; and for connected purposes

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Race Relations (Election Candidates)
item.description: The aim of this Bill is to increase the number of elected representatives from different ethnic groups by making provision for political parties to have the option of drawing up shortlists for candidates on the grounds of ethnicity. It would do this by exempting the selection of candidates from the provisions of the Race Relations Act 1976 and the Race Relations (Northern Ireland) Order 1997.

item.title: Banking (Special Provisions)
item.description: A Bill to make provision to enable the Treasury in certain circumstances to make an order relating to the transfer of securities issued by, or of property, rights or liabilities belonging to an authorised deposit-taker; to make further provision in relation to building societies; and for connected purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Allotments (Planning)
item.description: A Bill to encourage local authorities to make provision for allotments; to require them to consider imposing duties on developers to provide land for statutory allotments when determining planning applications; and for connected purposes

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Criminal Justice (Raves)
item.description: A Bill to amend the Criminal Justice and Public Order Act 1994 powers in relation to illegal raves

item.title: Copyright in Sound Recordings and Performers' Rights (Term Extension)
item.description: A Bill to extend the duration of copyright in sound recordings and of performers' rights; and for connected purposes

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Small Print
item.description: A Bill to make requirements regarding the minimum size of print in certain documents, including those relating to advertising and contracts; and for connected purposes

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Personal Debt (Advice and Regulation)
item.description: A BIll to require schools to provide education on personal money management; to make provision about advice centres on personal finance; to impose conditions on the activities of money-lending companies; and for connected purposes

item.title: Statute Law (Repeals)
item.description: A Bill to promote the reform of the statute law by the repeal, in accordance with recommendations of the Law Commission and the Scottish Law Commission, of certain enactments which (except in so far as their effect is preserved) are no longer of practical utility, and to make other provision in connection with the repeal of those enactments.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (Starting in the House of Lords)
item.title: House of Lords (Members' Taxation Status)
item.description: A Bill to make provision about the taxation status of Members of the House of Lords.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Autumn Bank Holiday
item.description: A Bill to introduce a bank holiday in the Autumn

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Fireworks Act 2003 (Amendment)
item.description: A Bill to make provision about the noise emitted by fireworks supplied in the United Kingdom

item.title: Consolidated Fund (Appropriation)
item.description: A Bill to authorise the use of resources for the service of the years ending with 31st March 2007 and 31st March 2008 and to apply certain sums out of the Consolidated Fund to the service of the year ending with 31st Marcy 2008; and to appropriate the supply authorised in this Session of Parliament for the service of the years ending with 31st March 2007 and 31st March 2008.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (Starting in the House of Lords)
item.title: Sunday Trading (Horticulture)
item.description: A Bill to amend the Sunday Trading Act 1994 in connection with the sale of horticultural supplies.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Environmental Protection Act 1990 (Amendment)
item.description: A Bill to amend Part II of the Environmental Protection Act 1990 in relation to the duties, powers and functions of waste regulation authorities concerning the unauthorised deposit of controlled waste on land; and for connected purposes

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Nail Bars and Special Treatment Premises (Regulation)
item.description: A Bill to make provision for the licensing of nail bars and premises where, tattooing, cosmetic piercing and other prescribed treatments are carried out; and for connected purposes

item.category: Private Members' Bill (Starting in the House of Lords)
item.title: Immigration (Discharged Gurkhas)
item.description: A Bill to amend the Immigration Rules in connection with the requirements for indefinite leave to enter and remain in the United Kingdom as a Gurkha discharged from the British Army.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Land Use (Garden Protection)
item.description: A Bill make provision for the protection of gardens and urbans green spaces; and for connected purposes

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Local Authority Powers (Election Campaigns)
item.description: A Bill to impose restrictions on the types of decisions that local authorities can take during specified periods prior to local elections; and for connected purposes

item.category: Private Members' Bill (Starting in the House of Lords)
item.title: Iraq War Inquiry
item.description: A Bill to make provision for the holding of an inquiry into the Iraq war.

item.title: Sustainable Energy (Local Plans)
item.description: A Bill to promote energy efficiency; to require specific bodies to publish sustainable energy plans; to make provision for the transfer of functions to principal councils; and for connected purposes

item.title: Microgeneration (Definition) (Amendment)
item.description: A Bill to amend the definition of "microgeneration" in certain Acts

item.title: Finance
item.description: A Bill to Grant certain duties, to alter other duties, and to amend the law relating to the National Debt and the Public Revenue, and to make further provision in connection with finance.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Offshore Oil and Gas Industries (Health and Safety)
item.description: A Bill to make further provision to secure the health, safety and welfare of persons at work in offshore oil and gas industries; and for connected purposes

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Illegally Logged Timber (Prohibition of Sale and Distribution)
item.description: A Bill to make it an offence for any importer or distributor to sell or distribute in the United Kingdom any wood harvested, manufactured or otherwise dealt with illegally in the country from which the wood originated or through which it passed or was transhipped; and for connected purposes

item.category: Private Members' Bill (Starting in the House of Lords)
item.title: Borough Freedom (No. 2)
item.description: A Bill to enable rights of admission to the freedom of cities or towns to be extended to women; to enable other amendments relating to admission to be made; to confer powers to admit persons as honorary freemen of certain places in the Confederation of the Cinque Ports; and for connected purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Road Traffic (Safety)
item.description: A Bill to make provision about the content of driving tests; to create offences relating to dangerous driving; and for connected purposes

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Right to Roam (Mobile Phones)
item.description: A Bill to make provision about roaming by mobile phone users between telephone networks within the United Kingdom; to make provision about the sharing of transmission masts; and for connected purposes

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Citizens' Initiative (Legislation)

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Immigration (Discharged Gurkhas) (No. 2)
item.description: to amend the Immigration Rules in connection with the requirements for indefinite leave to enter and remain in the United Kingdom as a Gurkha discharged from the British Army

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Armed Forces (Federation)
item.description: to make provision for the establishment of a Federation of the Armed Forces; and for connected puposes

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Management of Dementia in Care Homes
item.description: to regulate the prescription of anti-psychotic drugs for people with dementia in care homes; to require the introduction of protocols for the prescribing, monitoring and review of such medication; to make dementia training, including the use of anti-psychotics, mandatory for care home staff; to require care homes to obtain support from specified external services; and for connected purposes

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Adults with Autism
item.description: to impose duties upon the Secretary of State and certain organisations involved in health and social care in respect of support for people aged 18 and over with autism; and for connected purposes

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Committee on the Grant of Honours, Decorations and Medals
item.description: to provide for parliamentary scrutiny of the Committee on the Grant of Honours, Decorations and Medals

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Members of Parliament (Pay and Responsibilities)
item.description: to require the Senior Salaries Review Body to take account of transfers of powers between Parliament and European Union institutions when making recommendations on the pay of Members of Parliament; and for connected purposes

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Bank Holiday (Contribution of Polish Citizens)
item.description: to establish a bank holiday to celebrate the contribution of Polish citizens to Great Britain since 1940

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Alcohol Sales (Regulation of Prices and Promotion)
item.description: to regulate prices charged for units of alcoholic drinks; to regulate point of sale promotions, advertising and labelling of alcoholic drinks; to establish an industry council to administer the regulation of prices and promotions; and for connected purposes

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: DNA Database (Removal of Samples)
item.description: to require the removal from the DNA Database of DNA samples taken from individuals who are not charged or are acquitted; and for connected purposes

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Local Authorities (Social Equality Audits)
item.description: to require local authorities to collate and publish specific, economic and other data on an annual basis; and for connected puposes

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Sex Encounter Establishments (Licensing)
item.description: to make provision for the licensing of sex encounter establishments in England and Wales; and for connected purposes

item.description: to prohibit the breeding, selling, purchasing and keeping of primates a pets in the United Kingdom; and for connected purposes

item.title: Consolidated Fund (Appropriation) (No.3)
item.description: A Bill to authorise the use of resources for the service of the year ending with 31st March 2009 and to apply a sum out of the Consolidated Fund to the service of that year; and to appropriate the supply authorised by this Act for the service of that year.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)

item.category: Private Members' Bill (Starting in the House of Lords)

item.description: A Bill to amend the objectives of the Bank of England in relation to monetary policy.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Interest Rates (Maximum Limit)
item.description: to make provision for a maximum limit for interest rates to be prescribed; and for connected purposes

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Children (Protection of Privacy)
item.description: to make provision to protect children's privacy in the media; to make provision for the protection of children from avoidable emotional distress resulting from participating in, or being the subject of, media programmes or reports; and for connected purposes

item.title: Beverley Freemen
item.description: To re-state and extend the categories of person entitled by birthright to be enrolled as a Freeman of Beverley; to extend the area within which entitlement to be a Pasture Freeman may arise; to modify legislation relating to such entitlement; and for related purposes.

item.title: City of Westminster
item.description: A Bill to make provision for the control of street trading and touting in the City of Westminster.

item.title: Business Rate Supplements
item.description: A Bill to confer power on the Greater London Authority and certain local authorities to impose a levy on non-domestic ratepayers to raise money for expenditure on projects expected to promote economic development; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Saving Gateway Accounts
item.description: A Bill to make provision about Saving Gateway accounts; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Marine and Coastal Access
item.description: A Bill to make provision in relation to marine functions and activities; to make provision about migratory and freshwater fish; to make provision for and in connection with the establishment of an English coastal walking route and of rights of access to land near the English coast; to enable the making of Assembly Measures in relation to Welsh coastal routes for recreational journeys and rights of access to land near the Welsh coast; to make further provision in relation to Natural England and the Countryside Council of Wales; to make provision in relation to works which are detrimental to navigation; to amend the Harbours Act 1964; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Local Democracy, Economic Development and Construction

item.title: Banking (No. 2)
item.description: A Bill to make provision about banking.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (Starting in the House of Lords)
item.title: House of Lords
item.description: To make provision for the appointment of a Commission to make recommendations to the Crown for the creation of life peerages; to restrict membership of the House of Lords by virtue of hereditary peerage; to make provision for permanent leave of absence from the House of Lords; to provide for the expulsion of members of the House of Lords in specified circumstances; and for connected purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (Starting in the House of Lords)
item.title: House of Lords (Members' Taxation Status)
item.description: To make provision about the taxation status of Members of the House of Lords.

item.title: Corporation Tax

item.category: Private Members' Bill (Starting in the House of Lords)
item.title: Equal Pay and Flexible Working
item.description: To amend the Equal Pay Act 1970; and to make provision about flexible working.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (Starting in the House of Lords)

item.category: Private Members' Bill (Starting in the House of Lords)
