item.description: A Bill to provide certain protections for persons who live together as a couple or have lived together as a couple; and for connected purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (Starting in the House of Lords)
item.title: Dog Control
item.description: To make provision about the control of dogs and their welfare; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Consolidated Fund
item.description: To authorise the use of resources for the service of the years ending with 31 March 2009 and 31 March 2010 and to apply certain sums out of the Consolidated Fund to the service of the years ending with 31 March 2009 and 31 March 2010.

item.title: Coroners and Justice
item.description: A Bill to amend the law relating to coroners and to certification and registration of deaths; to amend the criminal law; to make provision about criminal justice and about dealing with offenders; to make provision about the Commissioner for Victims and Witnesses; to make provision relating to the security of court and other buildings; to make provision about legal aid; to make provision for payments to be made by offenders in respect of benefits derived from the exploitation of material pertaining to offences; to amend the Data Protection Act 1998; and for connected purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (Starting in the House of Lords)
item.title: Bank of England (Amendment)
item.description: To amend the objectives of the Bank of England in relation to monetary policy.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (Starting in the House of Lords)
item.title: Companiesâ€™ Remuneration Reports
item.description: To make provision about remuneration reports in public quoted company accounts and reports.

item.title: Policing and Crime
item.description: Make provision about the police; to make provision about prostitution, sex offenders, sex establishments and certain other premises; to make provision for reducing and dealing with the abuse of alcohol; to make provision about the proceeds of crime; to make provision about extradition; to amend the Aviation Security Act 1982; to make provision about criminal records and to amend the Safeguarding Vulnerable Groups Act 2006; to confer, extend or facilitate search, forfeiture and other powers relating to the United Kingdomâ€™s borders or elsewhere; to make further provision for combatting crime and disorder; to repeal redundant provisions; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Equality
item.description: Make provision to require Ministers of the Crown and others when making strategic decisions about the exercise of their functions to have regard to the desirability of reducing socio-economic inequalities; to reform and harmonise equality law and restate the greater part of the enactments relating to discrimination and harassment related to certain personal characteristics; to enable certain employers to be required to publish information about the differences in pay between male and female employees; to prohibit victimisation in certain circumstances; to require the exercise of certain functions to be with regard to the need to eliminate discrimination and other prohibited conduct; to enable duties to be imposed in relation to the exercise of public procurement functions; to increase equality of opportunity; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Geneva Conventions and United Nations Personnel (Protocols)

item.category: Registration of births, deaths and marriages
item.title: Welfare Reform

item.category: Private Members' Bill (Starting in the House of Lords)
item.title: Community Amateur Sports Clubs (Support)
item.description: To make provision in respect of Community Amateur Sports Clubs; and for connected purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (Starting in the House of Lords)

item.description: To make it a requirement for the providers of goods and services and the providers of specified facilities enabling the purchase of such goods and services to take reasonable steps, in certain circumstances, to establish the age of customers making such purchases remotely; and for connected purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (Starting in the House of Lords)

item.title: Green Energy (Definition and Promotion)
item.description: A Bill to define the term â€œgreen energyâ€; to promote its development, installation and usage; and for connected purposes.

item.description: A Bill to make provision about the acceptability of Scottish banknotes throughout the United Kingdom; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Lending (Regulation)

item.description: To make provision in relation to the Law Commission.

item.description: A Bill to make provision for a warning symbol to be prominently displayed on the packaging of pharmaceuticals which act on the brain and central nervous system so as to impair dangerously the consumerâ€™s ability to carry out certainactivities; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Torture (Damages) (No. 2)
item.description: A Bill to make provision for actions for damages for torture; and for connected purposes

item.description: A Bill to prohibit the sale in the United Kingdom of timber and wood products that were obtained or produced illegally in their country of origin; and for connected purposes

item.description: A Bill to make provision for the abolition of the television licence fee; and for connected purposes.

item.description: A Bill to establish a Commission to carry out regular audits of the economic costs and benefits of the UKâ€™s membership of the European Union; and for connected purposes.

item.description: A Bill to make provision for roadside testing for illegal drugs; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Pedlars (Amendment)
item.description: A Bill to amend the Pedlars Act 1871

item.description: A Bill to define public service content for the purposes of public service broadcasting

item.title: Safety Of Medicines (Evaluation)
item.description: A Bill to make provision about the evaluation of methods of testing the safety of medicines; and for connected purposes.

item.description: A Bill to provide that, notwithstanding the European Communities Act 1972, workers or members of a trade union who are UK nationals shall have rights of employment in the United Kingdom equal to or as favourable as those afforded to foreign nationals or conferred by the United Kingdom Parliament.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Exercise of Reasonable Discretion
item.description: A Bill to provide that public authorities and public servants shall not be subject to any criminal or civil penalty as a result of the exercise of reasonable discretion in the performance of their functions; and for connected purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (Starting in the House of Lords)
item.title: Sports Grounds Safety Authority
item.description: To confer further powers on the Football Licensing Authority and to amend its name; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Apprenticeships, Skills, Children and Learning
item.description: Make provision about apprenticeships, education, training and childrenâ€™s services; to amend the Employment Rights Act 1996; to establish the Young Peopleâ€™s Learning Agency for England, the office of Chief Executive of Skills Funding, the Office of Qualifications and Examinations Regulation and the School Support Staff Negotiating Body and to make provision about those bodies and that office; to make provision about the Qualifications and Curriculum Authority; to make provision about schools and institutions within the further education sector; to make provision about student loans; and for connected purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Employment Opportunities
item.description: A Bill to introduce more freedom, flexibility and opportunity for those seeking employment in the public and private sectors.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Climate Change (Sectoral Targets)
item.description: A Bill to set targets relating to energy generation and consumption; to make provision for the sectoral targets to be met; and for connected purposes.

item.description: Make provision in relation to policing and justice in Northern Ireland; and to amend section 86 of the Northern Ireland Act 1998

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Airport Expansion (Parliamentary Approval)
item.description: A Bill to amend the Planning Act 2008 to require Parliamentary approval for proposals for the building of new major airports and additional runways at existing major airports; and for connected purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)

item.description: A Bill to make provision for the compulsory teaching of British history in schools; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Industry and Exports (Financial Support)
item.description: A Bill to amend section 8(5) of the Industrial Development Act 1982 and to amend section 1(1) of the Export and Investment Guarantees Act 1991

item.title: Consolidated Fund (Appropriation)
item.description: To Authorise the use of resources for the service of the years ending with 31 March 2008 and 31 March 2009 and to apply certain sums out of the Consolidated Fund to the service of the years ending with 31 March 2008 and 31 March 2009; and to appropriate the supply authorised in this Session of Parliament for the service of the years ending with 31 March 2008 and 31 March 2009.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Bankers' Pensions (Limits)
item.description: A Bill to make provision for the pensions of board members of banks that are wholly or partly in public ownership to be limited in certain circumstances; and for connected purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Theft from Shops (Use of Penalty Notices for Disorder)
item.description: A Bill to restrict the use of penalty notices for disorder in respect of the offence of theft from retail and commercial premises; to revise sentencing guidelines in respect of this offence; to make provision for the recording on a national database of penalty notices for disorder issued; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Protection of Shareholders
item.description: A Bill to make provision for each public company to establish a shareholdersâ€™ committee; to make provision about the membership, functions and operation of the committee; and for connected purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Food Labelling Regulations (Amendment)
item.description: A Bill to amend the Food Labelling Regulations 1996 to provide for information about the country of origin of food to be made available to consumers; and for connected purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Young People Leaving Care (Accommodation)
item.description: A Bill to make provision for minimum standards in respect of accommodation for young people leaving care; to impose a duty on local authorities to ensure that such standards are met; and for connected purposes.

item.description: A Bill to make provision for the periodic review of the capital limits and tariff income rules and the personal expense allowance; to make provision for consultations on the level of those allowances and rules; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Finance
item.description: A Bill to grant certain duties, to alter other duties, and to amend the law relating to the National Debt and the Public Review, and to make further provision in connection with finance.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Cohabitation (No. 2)
item.description: A Bill to provide certain protections for persons who live together as a couple or have lived together as a couple; and for connected purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (Starting in the House of Lords)
item.title: Constitutional Renewal

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Council Tax Rebate

item.title: Perpetuities and Accumulations
item.description: To amend the law relating to the avoidance of future interests on grounds of remoteness and the law relating to accumulations of income.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Registration of Births and Deaths (Welsh Language)
item.description: A bill to make provision about the registration of births and deaths where particulars are given in Welsh and English; to permit certificates of particulars of entries of registers of births and deaths to be in Welsh or English only in such circumstances; and for connected purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Insolvency (Provision of Information to Employment Agencies)
item.description: A Bill to require insolvency practitioners to provide information regarding redundancies to employment agencies when a company goes into administration within a specified period; and for connected purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Cheapest Energy Tariff (Information)
item.description: A Bill to amend the law relating to the regulation of domestic energy providers; to require an energy company to publish on invoices information indicating whether the customer is on the cheapest tariff offered by that company, based on pattern of energy use, and the savings to be gained from any switch to this tariff; and for connected purposes

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Protection of Children (Publicity)
item.description: A Bill to prevent the exploitation by parents of their children by means of seeking publicity, primarily for the purpose of financial gain, in respect of the actions of such children; and for connected purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Prevention of Excessive Charges
item.description: A Bill to prevent excessive charges or fees from being levied on consumers; and for connected purposes

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Sale of Mobile Homes (Interview)
item.description: A Bill to make provision about the holding of interviews between site owners and prospective purchases of mobile homes prior to any sale.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Developing Country Debt (Restriction of Recovery)
item.description: A Bill to regulate the recovery of the defaulted sovereign debt of developing countries; and for connect purposes.
